Package com.globaltcad.swingtree

Class SplitItem.Delegate<I extends javax.swing.JMenuItem>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.globaltcad.swingtree.SplitItem.Delegate<I>
  • Type Parameters:
    I - The JMenuItem subtype for which this context was created.
    Enclosing class:
    SplitItem<I extends javax.swing.JMenuItem>
    public static final class SplitItem.Delegate<I extends javax.swing.JMenuItem>
extends java.lang.Object
    Instances of this are exposed as delegates through the SimpleDelegate passed to the actions supplied to SplitItem.onSelection(UIAction) in order to give said actions all the necessary context they need to perform whatever action they so desire.

        Returns:

      • getSiblings

        public java.util.List<I> getSiblings()
        Returns:
        A list of all the JMenuItem which constitute the options exposed by the JSplitButton except the current JMenuItem exposed by getCurrentItem().

      • selectCurrentItem

        public SplitItem.Delegate<I> selectCurrentItem()
        Selects the current JMenuItem by passing true to the AbstractButton.setSelected(boolean) method.
        Returns:
        This SplitItem.Delegate instance to allow for method chaining.

      • selectOnlyCurrentItem

        public SplitItem.Delegate<I> selectOnlyCurrentItem()
        Selects only the current JMenuItem by passing true to the AbstractButton.setSelected(boolean) method. All other JMenuItems will be unselected.
        Returns:
        This SplitItem.Delegate instance to allow for method chaining.

      • unselectCurrentItem

        public SplitItem.Delegate<I> unselectCurrentItem()
        Unselects the current JMenuItem by passing false to the AbstractButton.setSelected(boolean) method.
        Returns:
        This SplitItem.Delegate instance to allow for method chaining.

      • unselectAllItems

        public SplitItem.Delegate<I> unselectAllItems()
        Unselects all JMenuItems by passing false to their AbstractButton.setSelected(boolean) methods.
        Returns:
        This SplitItem.Delegate instance to allow for method chaining.

      • selectOnlyItem

        public SplitItem.Delegate<I> selectOnlyItem​(int i)

        Returns:
        This SplitItem.Delegate instance to allow for method chaining.

      • find

        public final <T extends javax.swing.JComponent> java.util.Optional<T> find​(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                                                                           java.lang.String id)
        Use this to query the UI tree and find any JComponent.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type parameter of the component which should be found.
        Parameters:
        type - The JComponent type which should be found in the swing tree.
        id - The ide of the JComponent which should be found in the swing tree.
        Returns:
        An Optional instance which may or may not contain the requested component.
